channel.title: Design engineering services by service design and business architecture
channel.description: Design engineering services by service design and business architecture

item.title: Practical Service Design - guides, resources, and community
item.description:
Practical Service Design - guides, resources, and community

Our world is now made of services. We need new tools to think across this space, to not only create memorable and valuable experiences for our customers, but also empower our organizations to change the way we do business for the better.

item.title: Video: What is service design?
item.description:
Video: What is service design?

Design Methods Step 1: Discover Step one in a four-part guide for anyone who wants to understand the methods designers use and try them out for themselves. Discover - keep your perspectives wide, allowing for a broad range of ideas and influences.

item.title: Francisco Guzman // On the Other Side of the Line: Designing with Shoppers in Mind // Service Experience Conference 2015
item.description:
Francisco Guzman // On the Other Side of the Line: Designing with Shoppers in Mind // Service Experience Conference 2015

With Instacart, customers can get groceries delivered from their favorite local stores in as little as an hour. Behind the scenes, Instacart is powered by an amazing...

item.title: Katie Koch // Putting Service Design Into Practice // Service Experience Conference 2015
item.description:
Katie Koch // Putting Service Design Into Practice // Service Experience Conference 2015

How do you practice service design when you don't have the budget, time, or scope to impact the entire service? On my design team at American Express we've...

item.title: Design Maturity Survey
item.description:
Design Maturity Survey

Is design at the core of your organization? How do you increase its impact on your business? These are the insights our Design Maturity Survey strives to deliver. While doubts about investing in design are evaporating, methodologies on how to measure and improve its effectiveness are non-existent.

item.title: We Categorized 327 User Onboarding Experiences Into 9 UI Patterns (Find Out Which You Should Use)
item.description:
We Categorized 327 User Onboarding Experiences Into 9 UI Patterns (Find Out Which You Should Use)

User onboarding is a once in a user's lifecycle experience that-when done well-bridges a delicate journey between your sign up page and your user's first value gained from your product. We refer to this moment of value as a user's Wow or Aha! moment -Aha like, " Wow this is awesome!"

item.title: How to Grow in 190 Markets: 4 Lessons from Airbnb
item.description:
How to Grow in 190 Markets: 4 Lessons from Airbnb

Few companies have had the kind of global success of Airbnb. Seven years ago, the company started in San Francisco, by allowing people to turn their spare bedrooms and homes into vacation rentals. Today, Airbnb has over 1,000,000 listings in 34,000 cities and 190 countries.

item.title: 5 UX plays to start your design on good tracks - Prototyping: From UX to Front End
item.description:
5 UX plays to start your design on good tracks - Prototyping: From UX to Front End

When I start a new design (a full project or a feature) I turn off my computer. I make sure to delay the launch of a design software as much as I can. I need to make sure that I get the big picture of what I am working on.

item.title: Justin Jackson
item.description:
Justin Jackson

A lot of people want to be the next Mark Zuckerberg. I want to be the next Larry Page, the next Mark Zuckerberg.. How do I do that? - Ty (@ShoootingStarr) May 6, 2013 I want to create the next hot thing. I want to be sitting in a meeting with Mark Zuckerberg and Bill Gates.

item.title: 20 Fascinating Examples of Bold Design Selected by Muzli
item.description:
20 Fascinating Examples of Bold Design Selected by Muzli

If you're subscribed to my list, you know that in the first email, I ask you what is your biggest struggle with design in business. A huge number of people reply to this email (and I respond to almost all of them). And it turns out that many readers seem to be struggling with finding great design inspiration.
